statements.name: PROC PARTITION
statements.description: The PARTITION procedure performs simple random sampling, stratified sampling, and oversampling to produce a table with a subset of the observations or with observations partitioned. † The PARTITION procedure creates the following: † o one output data table, which contains the sampled or partitioned data table o one summary table, which contains the numbers of observations and variables in the data table o one frequency table, which contains the frequency information for the population and sample

arguments.name: DATA=
arguments.description: Syntax: DATA=CAS-libref.data-table names the input data table for PROC PARTITION to use. CAS-libref.data-table is a two-level name, where

arguments.name: NTHREADS=
arguments.description: Specifies the number of threads to be used. The default is the CPU count on each node.

arguments.name: PARTIND
arguments.description: Adds to the output data table a partition indicator, _PartInd_, which indicates whether an observation is selected to a partition (1 or 2) or not (0).

arguments.name: SAMPPCT2=
arguments.description: [For simple random sampling and stratified sampling only]

arguments.name: SAMPPCT=
arguments.description: [For simple random sampling and stratified sampling only]

arguments.name: SEED=
arguments.description: Specifies an integer that is used to start the pseudorandom number generator. If you do not specify a seed or you specify a value less than or equal to 0, the seed is generated from reading the time of day from the computer’s clock. The SEED= option enables you to reproduce the same sample output.

statements.name: BY
statements.description: The BY statement specifies classification variables to be used for stratification. There is no limit on the by variables for stratified sampling, but only one by variable is allowed for oversampling.

statements.name: DISPLAY
statements.description: The DISPLAY statement enables you to specify a list of ODS tables to display or exclude. This statement is similar to the ODS SELECT, ODS EXCLUDE, and ODS TRACE statements.

arguments.name: CASESENSITIVE
arguments.description: Indicates that a case-sensitive compare must be done when filtering tables for display. Note that unquoted table names are always uppercased. So table names must be quoted to preserve case.

arguments.name: EXCLUDE
arguments.description: Displays all tables except the specified list.

arguments.name: EXCLUDEALL
arguments.description: Suppresses display of all tables. This option takes precedence over the other options.

arguments.name: TRACE
arguments.description: Displays the table names, labels, and paths.

statements.name: OUTPUT
statements.description: The OUTPUT statement creates a data table to contain the sample observations and stratification information for the sample.

arguments.name: OUT=
arguments.description: Names the output data table for PROC PARTITION to use. CAS-libref.data-table is a two-level name, where

arguments.name: COPYVAR=
arguments.description: Lists one or more variables from the input data table to be transferred to the output data table.

arguments.name: FREQNAME=
arguments.description: Renames the _Freq_ variable (which is generated in the oversampling case) to the specified freq-name.

arguments.name: PARTINDNAME=
arguments.description: Renames the generated partition indicator ,_PartInd_, to the specified partition-indicator-name.
